title: "MDBX_PANIC: Likely because hardware failure" when in reality ran out of storage
body:
#### System information

Erigon version: 2022.07.4-alpha-d88fc824

OS & Version: OSX

Commit hash : d88fc8242789a5f6df0ce77168e473715178d6df

#### Expected behaviour

I was syncing erigon at the block execution stage and it consumed all my disk. Erigon should tell me that there is no disk space left. It could retry every X seconds to see if there is space now. 

#### Actual behaviour

Tons of panic messages about hardware error, non-stop:

```
INFO[07-31|09:24:54.773] [6/16 Execution] Executed blocks         number=11497114 blk/s=47.6 tx/s=9184.8 Mgas/s=581.7 gasState=0.95 batch=1.4GB alloc=7.3GB sys=15.3GB
INFO[07-31|09:25:14.762] [6/16 Execution] Executed blocks         number=11498054 blk/s=47.0 tx/s=8496.0 Mgas/s=579.5 gasState=0.97 batch=1.5GB alloc=7.1GB sys=15.3GB
INFO[07-31|09:25:34.774] [6/16 Execution] Executed blocks         number=11499013 blk/s=47.9 tx/s=7593.4 Mgas/s=585.3 gasState=0.99 batch=1.5GB alloc=6.6GB sys=15.3GB

EROR[07-31|09:28:43.660] [txpool] process batch remote txs        err="mdbx_txn_begin: MDBX_PANIC: Likely because hardware failure. Before creating issue please use tools like https://www.memtest86.com to test RAM and tools like https://www.smartmontools.org to test Disk. To handle hardware risks: use ECC RAM, use RAID of disks, run multiple application instances (or do backups). If hardware checks passed - check FS settings - 'fsync' and 'flock' must be enabled.  Otherwise - please create issue in Application repo. On default DURABLE mode, power outage can't cause this error. On other modes - power outage may break last transaction and mdbx_chk can recover db in this case, see '-t' and '-0|1|2' options., label: chaindata, trace: [kv_mdbx.go:442 pool.go:480 pool.go:1344 asm_arm64.s:1263]"
```

#### How to use less space?

Also, at this point the erigon folder is 775G. I thought that 400G was enough but I need some prune flags. I'm running for staking, can someone point me to the prune flags for staking?
Yes, miss-leading error message in this case. But it’s useful in other cases.

Excuse me for asking this because it would imply that you didn't check... 
Is there no distinction from hardware errors? nothing in the exception that could tell you it is caused by lack of space?
I guess you can't do much if you get a panic exception :) It must be something coming from the lmdb library
mdbx and lmdb do not return error messages. they return only error codes - numbers. sometime 1 code for multiple reasons.
